summary: “The Westermarck effect, or reverse sexual imprinting, is a hypothetical psychological effect through which people who live in...
body:
“The Westermarck effect, or reverse sexual imprinting, is a hypothetical psychological effect through which people who live in close domestic proximity during the first few years of their lives become desensitized to sexual attraction.”

Arya will be more forgiving… until she realises, with terror, that SHE HAS FALLEN IN LOVE WITH JON, WHO IS NOT ONLY HER HALF-BROTHER, but also a man of the Night’s Watch, sworn to celibacy. THEIR PASSION will continue to torment Jon and Arya throughout the trilogy, until the secret of Jon’s true parentage is finally revealed in the last book.

body:
Stuns me how glorious this parallel is. Why? Because Brienne turns to Jamie first as Jon turns to Sansa. Just so they can get a last glance at the other person.

❤❤❤

tags: s8 will be his monte cristo moment of course
summary: To be honest even if you don't believe the undercover lover theory or political! Jon theory in season 7, you can't really say...
body: To be honest even if you don’t believe the undercover lover theory or political! Jon theory in season 7, you can’t really say Jon would never lie or go undercover lover because he did…we all knew that… Ygritte could attest to that… Ygritte experienced the betrayal even though in the end Jon came to love her IT WAS NOT ENOUGH FOR JON to renounce WHO HE REALLY IS… JON remain true to his mission and found out key information about the wildlings then returned back, escaped… then when he became Lord Commander, Jon played the game of thrones… in fact his experience at the Wall was like his training ground for political Jon! He juggled the demands of the brothers of the night’s watch that were against him, the wildlings, and Stannis very well for quite some time… sure he was not successful in the end in terms of the NW brothers because they killed him and betrayed him but i felt that it was a lesson learned on Jon’s part on how not to be so trusting when your adversaries do not play by the rules and not have any honor….and you can see it in how he handled the northern lords he made sure he left someone to hold the fort that is clever enough to handle them lol …someone schooled in playing the game and a better politician than he is haha… everything he did has always been to protect the North and his family… not because it was his duty but because it is his home and he loves his family. So any kind of scenario that somehow changes that and makes Jon change his purpose and will to fight by “falling in love” is really not believable and just doesn’t make sense unless the love story was given enough development and their connection was powerful enough to break his bond with his love for the North and his Stark family. And no, sex on a boat is not enough. I mean if sex in a cave with enough foreplay allotted into it did not make Jon Snow forget and forsake who he is then why should sex on a boat be any different… so yeah Jon Snow is many things but a northern fool he is definitely not…well unless he is the kind of “fool” that fooled everyone with his “honesty is the best policy” great speech because then yeah he is that… Jon WOULD and can definitely lie and manipulate when there is someone he needs to protect. Jon Snow, King in the North would not even hesitate…

tags: a song of ice and fire
body:
[Fan-fiction] GoT S8E6- The Final Sequence

The screen comes back to light after a couple of seconds of darkness. We see the Sun shining over the Red Keep and a welcome buzz around the city of King’s Landing

‘A few years later’, the screen says. 

The camera moves along a room inside the Red Keep and we hear a familiar voice.

“Come on Ned, I know you know this one. You only learned it last week,” Sam says.

Little Ned thinks for a second and then says, “Highgarden.”

“Very well lad! Now, which is next house on your list of the Great House of Westeros that are now extinct?”

Meanwhile, we see a silhouette of a man behind Ned. Youthful, dark hair and a muscular build. 

“Um, Lannister. Words- Hear me roar! Sigil- A Golden Lion on a field of crimson. The seat of power- Casterly Rock.”

We hear someone clapping in a distance. 

“Father!” Ned screams. 

We see Ned running into the arms of Jon as he embraces him. 

“You’re doing good. I think Grand Maester would agree that today’s class can be concluded now.”

Sam nods.

“Go on now. Your mother is looking for you,” Jon says to Ned who then runs out of the room.

“Aren’t your services required downstairs Grand Maester?” Jon asks.

“No, Your Grace,” Sam replies.

They laugh.

“Tell me, will he come to me in 10 years and tell me he wants to be a maester?” Jon asks.

“What? Rubbish! He is Jon Snow’s son. He won’t enjoy that life. Boredom isn’t in his blood.” They laugh again.

“How is she?” asks Sam.

“She is fine. Today wasn’t a part of her schemes when she was little but her handmaidens tell me that she likes her dress. But Gendry is baffled,” Jon laughs. 

“Is he? Doesn’t know where to put it? Didn’t you tell him where to put it?” Sam smiles.

“You’re talking about my sister. You know that, don’t you?”

“Apologies, Your Grace.” 

“Your Grace.” Jon sighs. “It’s been seven years, yet it hasn’t grown on me. Seems like yesterday we went north of the wall and took our vows. We swore to never own lands and take titles, to not take wives and have children. I’m pretty sure I’ve broken all of them,” Jon says. 

“Where were you? I was looking for you some hours ago,” Sam asks.

“The entire capital knows where I was. And you didn’t?”

“Ah! You were riding Drogon. The beast needed some fresh air. He had been in the Dragonspit for a month.” 

Jon walks towards a window in front of him and looks out.

“He reminds me of her. He is the only one who can. It’s been seven years since the war and sometimes I can’t even remember her face.” 

Sam looks sad and moves forward to comfort Jon. 

“Most of us were fighting for our lives. She was fighting for many lives. I know, it’s a pity. Life is not fair but life goes on. You know that better than most.”

“Aye! I guess I do.” Jon smiles a little, just to show Sam that he is okay.

“Will you ever tell Ned?” Sam says after a pause.

“Tell him what?” Jon asks.

“About his real mother. About Daenerys. You didn’t know about your real mother for a long time but it is a different situation for Ned. Unlike you, he won’t be killed by the King for it.” Sam says.

“What good will that do? And he has a mother just like I had a father. The only father I knew, and the only one I needed.”

“So you will let him think his entire life that his real mother is Sansa? She was his aunt but you made her his mother when you married her after the war.”

Silence.

“I married Sansa to unite the seven kingdoms. I am a Targaryen. And even though I was a Northman my entire life, the northern lords needed a better reason than that to give up their dream of independence and bend the knee to another Targaryen. I did it for the realm.” Jon says softly.

“Well, whatever happened is behind us. Today is a day of celebration. But I’m warning ya. If someday he finds out that his mother is not Sansa and that you decided to keep it from him, he won’t forgive you. Ned Stark is dead but would you have forgiven him had he lived?”

We see Ghost approaching from behind with Ser Davos who is wearing the badge of The Hand of the King- the first crabber’s son to wear the badge, as Stannis put it all those years ago. 

“It’s time, Your Grace. Lady Arya is waiting for you downstairs.”

“Good Luck,” Sam says as he leaves. 

“I’ve come too far from home Ser Davos,” Jon says after a few minutes.

“This your home now, Your Grace.”

“Doesn’t feel like home. I was never supposed to be here. I was never supposed to be King. I thought I would end my life on the wall, shivering for warmth. I have come way too far.”

“Well, you were supposed to be a bastard too. But suddenly you decided to become the true heir. You were supposed to be dead. But, you came back. Let’s face it, Jon, you’ve surprised life more than life has surprised you. Do you really think this is the biggest one?” Davos says.

“Where would you put it on your list?” Jon asks.

“Probably at the bottom, Your Grace,” Davos replies.

“Aye! The bottom seems about right.”

Ser Davos has a letter in his hand and he looks hesitant.

Finally, he begins, “There was a raven, Your Grace, from Winterfell, from Lord Stark.”

“Now that sounds like home. He still prefer being called Bran though.” He smiles a little. “What does it say?”

“He has had another vision,” Ser Davos looks concerned.

Ser Davos hands him the letter. Jon sits down. Ghost beside him tries to take a look.

“Winter is Coming,” Jon says and starts laughing along with Ser Davos.

The camera zooms out and the screen turns black, the Stark theme runs in the background.

Ser Davos has a letter in his hand and he looks hesitant.

Finally, he begins, “There was a raven, Your Grace, from Winterfell, from Lord Stark.”

“Now that sounds like home. He still prefer being called Bran though.” He smiles a little. “What does it say?”

“He has had another vision,” Ser Davos looks concerned.

Ser Davos hands him the letter. Jon sits down. Ghost beside him tries to take a look.

“Winter is Coming,” Jon says and starts laughing along with Ser Davos.

The camera zooms out and the screen turns black, the Stark theme runs in the background.

trail.content_raw:
[Fan-fiction] GoT S8E6- The Final Sequence

The screen comes back to light after a couple of seconds of darkness. We see the Sun shining over the Red Keep and a welcome buzz around the city of King’s Landing

‘A few years later’, the screen says. 

The camera moves along a room inside the Red Keep and we hear a familiar voice.

“Come on Ned, I know you know this one. You only learned it last week,” Sam says.

Little Ned thinks for a second and then says, “Highgarden.”

“Very well lad! Now, which is next house on your list of the Great House of Westeros that are now extinct?”

Meanwhile, we see a silhouette of a man behind Ned. Youthful, dark hair and a muscular build. 

“Um, Lannister. Words- Hear me roar! Sigil- A Golden Lion on a field of crimson. The seat of power- Casterly Rock.”

We hear someone clapping in a distance. 

“Father!” Ned screams. 

We see Ned running into the arms of Jon as he embraces him. 

“You’re doing good. I think Grand Maester would agree that today’s class can be concluded now.”

Sam nods.

“Go on now. Your mother is looking for you,” Jon says to Ned who then runs out of the room.

“Aren’t your services required downstairs Grand Maester?” Jon asks.

“No, Your Grace,” Sam replies.

They laugh.

“Tell me, will he come to me in 10 years and tell me he wants to be a maester?” Jon asks.

“What? Rubbish! He is Jon Snow’s son. He won’t enjoy that life. Boredom isn’t in his blood.” They laugh again.

“How is she?” asks Sam.

“She is fine. Today wasn’t a part of her schemes when she was little but her handmaidens tell me that she likes her dress. But Gendry is baffled,” Jon laughs. 

“Is he? Doesn’t know where to put it? Didn’t you tell him where to put it?” Sam smiles.

“You’re talking about my sister. You know that, don’t you?”

“Apologies, Your Grace.” 

“Your Grace.” Jon sighs. “It’s been seven years, yet it hasn’t grown on me. Seems like yesterday we went north of the wall and took our vows. We swore to never own lands and take titles, to not take wives and have children. I’m pretty sure I’ve broken all of them,” Jon says. 

“Where were you? I was looking for you some hours ago,” Sam asks.

“The entire capital knows where I was. And you didn’t?”

“Ah! You were riding Drogon. The beast needed some fresh air. He had been in the Dragonspit for a month.” 

Jon walks towards a window in front of him and looks out.

“He reminds me of her. He is the only one who can. It’s been seven years since the war and sometimes I can’t even remember her face.” 

Sam looks sad and moves forward to comfort Jon. 

“Most of us were fighting for our lives. She was fighting for many lives. I know, it’s a pity. Life is not fair but life goes on. You know that better than most.”

“Aye! I guess I do.” Jon smiles a little, just to show Sam that he is okay.

“Will you ever tell Ned?” Sam says after a pause.

“Tell him what?” Jon asks.

“About his real mother. About Daenerys. You didn’t know about your real mother for a long time but it is a different situation for Ned. Unlike you, he won’t be killed by the King for it.” Sam says.

“What good will that do? And he has a mother just like I had a father. The only father I knew, and the only one I needed.”

“So you will let him think his entire life that his real mother is Sansa? She was his aunt but you made her his mother when you married her after the war.”

Silence.

“I married Sansa to unite the seven kingdoms. I am a Targaryen. And even though I was a Northman my entire life, the northern lords needed a better reason than that to give up their dream of independence and bend the knee to another Targaryen. I did it for the realm.” Jon says softly.

“Well, whatever happened is behind us. Today is a day of celebration. But I’m warning ya. If someday he finds out that his mother is not Sansa and that you decided to keep it from him, he won’t forgive you. Ned Stark is dead but would you have forgiven him had he lived?”

We see Ghost approaching from behind with Ser Davos who is wearing the badge of The Hand of the King- the first crabber’s son to wear the badge, as Stannis put it all those years ago. 

“It’s time, Your Grace. Lady Arya is waiting for you downstairs.”

“Good Luck,” Sam says as he leaves. 

“I’ve come too far from home Ser Davos,” Jon says after a few minutes.

“This your home now, Your Grace.”

“Doesn’t feel like home. I was never supposed to be here. I was never supposed to be King. I thought I would end my life on the wall, shivering for warmth. I have come way too far.”

“Well, you were supposed to be a bastard too. But suddenly you decided to become the true heir. You were supposed to be dead. But, you came back. Let’s face it, Jon, you’ve surprised life more than life has surprised you. Do you really think this is the biggest one?” Davos says.

“Where would you put it on your list?” Jon asks.

“Probably at the bottom, Your Grace,” Davos replies.

“Aye! The bottom seems about right.”

Ser Davos has a letter in his hand and he looks hesitant.

Finally, he begins, “There was a raven, Your Grace, from Winterfell, from Lord Stark.”

“Now that sounds like home. He still prefer being called Bran though.” He smiles a little. “What does it say?”

“He has had another vision,” Ser Davos looks concerned.

Ser Davos hands him the letter. Jon sits down. Ghost beside him tries to take a look.

“Winter is Coming,” Jon says and starts laughing along with Ser Davos.

The camera zooms out and the screen turns black, the Stark theme runs in the background.

“Well, whatever happened is behind us. Today is a day of celebration. But I’m warning ya. If someday he finds out that his mother is not Sansa and that you decided to keep it from him, he won’t forgive you. Ned Stark is dead but would you have forgiven him had he lived?”

“I’ve come too far from home Ser Davos,” Jon says after a few minutes.

“Doesn’t feel like home. I was never supposed to be here. I was never supposed to be King. I thought I would end my life on the wall, shivering for warmth. I have come way too far.”

“Well, you were supposed to be a bastard too. But suddenly you decided to become the true heir. You were supposed to be dead. But, you came back. Let’s face it, Jon, you’ve surprised life more than life has surprised you. Do you really think this is the biggest one?” Davos says.

“Where would you put it on your list?” Jon asks.

“Probably at the bottom, Your Grace,” Davos replies.

“Aye! The bottom seems about right.”

Ser Davos has a letter in his hand and he looks hesitant.

Finally, he begins, “There was a raven, Your Grace, from Winterfell, from Lord Stark.”

“Now that sounds like home. He still prefer being called Bran though.” He smiles a little. “What does it say?”

summary: @fandomaestheticnet: gtktm event » favourite characters: jon snow (game of thrones)  You all crowned my your king. I never...
caption:
@fandomaestheticnet: gtktm event » favourite characters: jon snow (game of thrones)

You all crowned my your king. I never wanted it. I never asked for it. But I accepted it because the North is my home. It’s part of me, and I will never stop fighting for it, no matter the odds.

tags: เกมล่าบัลลังก์
summary: Kit Harington explains why he's still rocking his 'Game of Thrones' look
title: Kit Harington explains why he's still rocking his 'Game of Thrones' look
excerpt: Game of Thrones has wrapped filming for its final season, but you wouldn't know it from the looks of Kit Harington,…
description:
Filming for Season 8 has been completed. But there could be a need for reshoots. Kit Harington explains that he’s still looking like Jon Snow because of this possibility.

Here’s another (hypothetical) possibility: The showrunners may have a surprise ending in mind which they don’t want most of the actors and production crew to know about. A “reshoot” involving Kit and a few other actors could be the actual ending rather than the one which most of the cast currently assumes will take place.

tags: anti anything that has jon acting like a 4chan or reddit scumbag incel
summary: Political Tyrion, not Political Jon according to th spoilers?
body:
Political Tyrion, not Political Jon according to th spoilers?

Tyrion trying to throw a wrench between the Starks/North and Dany but failing because J/D are in love (and in what I’m all but certain will happen, SANSA proposing their marriage against Tyrion’s wishes) and married and a family? Dany (and her baby) as part of the Stark pack and will never turn against them. That’s why he was so concerned about boatsex.

The reveal of his betrayal happens in a massive scene with Jon/Dany/Sansa/Arya/Tyrion. Why have the Starks there if not for Dany’s emotional support or the physical representation of the choice presented: the Starks (and honor) or Tyrion (and the game)? We know she chooses the Starks. Lolllllll.

But I was told she was a MAD QUEEEEEEEN AND THE FINAL VILLAIIIIIIIIN.

Political Jon is dead. It died like it lived: never drawing a single breath.

blog.name: turtle-paced

summary: Is it really that important for Jon to know he's a prophecized hero? It seems neither interesting nor necessary and it may even...
question: Is it really that important for Jon to know he's a prophecized hero? It seems neither interesting nor necessary and it may even be wrong. I feel like most characters who hear a prophecy are going to screw themselves over, so maybe the only prophecy Jon will be fooled by is the grey girl.
answer:
Yes, I think so - or at least that Jon will know about the prophecy Rhaegar was intending to fulfil with him. It’s the best way to come to an explicit conclusion that it’s not being a destined hero that makes him a hero. It’s his choices and his actions, independent on his biological parentage, that make Jon who he is. 

Screw destiny; Jon’s doing what’s right, because it is right. I think that’s probably best done with full knowledge of what’s wrong, and why it’s wrong.
